headline: Moderna shares jump on data from early coronavirus vaccine trial

headline: Swatch Group free to supply watch movements, says Swiss watchdog

headline: Take Five: World stocks' 2020 rollercoaster ride rumbles on

Borrowing costs for high-grade U.S. companies have in fact fallen below January levels.

headline: Pfizer declines about 8% after setback to breast cancer treatment
text: Shares of Pfizer Inc  fell nearly 8% on Monday after an independent data monitoring committee determined the drugmaker's breast cancer treatment was unlikely to meet the main goal of a late-stage study.

headline: Nasdaq keeps Philadelphia trading floor closed due to protests
text: Nasdaq Inc said it postponed Monday's planned reopening of its PHLX options trading floor in Philadelphia, which had been closed because of the coronavirus pandemic, due to the demonstrations over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.
GICS_Subsectors: 6. IT Consulting & Other Services; Real Estate Services
GICS_Subsectors_Mapped: IT Consulting & Other Services; Real Estate Services

headline: Rich world's jobs crisis jolts money flows to millions
text: Carlos Sosa, a Salvadoran waiter in New York, used to send up to $500 a month back home to his mother to help pay for her medical bills and food. But now, after the coronavirus hit and he lost his job in early March, Sosa has burned through his savings and the wire transfers have stopped.

headline: Spanish telecom operator MasMovil agrees $3.3 billion private equity bid
text: KKR , Cinven and Providence said on Monday they had made a 2.96 billion euro ($3.3 billion) board-backed bid for Spanish telecoms operator MasMovil .

headline: Aircraft makers go digital to fight coronavirus delivery logjam
text: Helicopter and jet makers are turning to digital technology so customers can inspect their big-ticket purchases remotely before taking delivery, as they strive to push through deals paralyzed by the coronavirus pandemic and bring in much needed cash.

headline: Gilead trades that made millions on COVID-19 drug news raise eyebrows
text: Well-timed trades in Gilead Sciences Inc's  options ahead of good news on the biopharmaceutical company's COVID-19 drug treatment may draw regulatory scrutiny, experts said.

headline: U.S. utilities look newly cheap, but face COVID-19 headwinds this summer
text: U.S. utility stocks have started to look like bargains after being considered expensive relative to the broader market for well over a year. Still, the outlook is far from certain as demand this summer is set to be hard hit by the contraction in commercial and industrial usage.

headline: London Stock Exchange finds broad backing for shorter trading day
text: There is broad backing in stock markets for cutting the trading day by 90 minutes in a coordinated way across European exchanges, the London Stock Exchange said on Monday.

headline: Walmart's Flipkart to re-apply for food retail license in India
text: Walmart Inc's  Indian e-commerce unit Flipkart said on Monday it would re-apply for a food retail license in India after reports said its earlier proposal was rejected by the government last week.

headline: Wall Street and Fed fly blind as coronavirus upends annual stress tests
text: U.S. financial regulators, banks and their investors will get their first glimpse into the health of the nation's banking system as it confronts soaring corporate and consumer defaults in the economic crisis sparked by the novel coronavirus.

headline: Factbox: What's new with the Fed's 2020 bank stress tests?
text: The Federal Reserve's bank stress tests will look significantly different in 2020, thanks to regulatory changes and the dramatic economic turmoil brought on by coronavirus pandemic.

headline: Europe's factories starting to recover, Asia's pain worsens
text: European manufacturers may be over the worst of a coronavirus-driven downturn, but Asia's pain deepened in May due to a slump in global trade, with export powerhouses Japan and South Korea seeing the sharpest falls in activity in over a decade, surveys showed.

headline: Buffett-backed BYD to supply EV batteries to Ford
text: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker BYD Co Ltd ,  will supply EV batteries to U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co , a document on the website of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology showed on Monday.

headline: Opel to add PSA model to Ruesselsheim production: Handelsblatt

headline: Yum China to bring Beyond Meat's plant-based burgers to China
text: Yum China Holdings Inc  said on Monday it will introduce Beyond Meat Inc's  plant-based burgers at its fast-food restaurants in mainland China starting June 3.

headline: Emirates could take four years to resume flying to entire network
text: Emirates' outgoing President Tim Clark on Monday said it could take the state carrier up to four years to resume flying to its entire network that has been decimated by the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: Worst may be over for euro zone factories, recovery to be slow: PMI
text: Euro zone manufacturers appear to have passed their nadir, a survey showed on Monday, but activity is still contracting sharply as government-imposed lockdowns due to the coronavirus pandemic keep demand in check.

headline: Hyundai Motor's May sales fall sharply year-on-year on COVID-19 impact
text: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Co  said on Monday its provisional May sales fell 39% year-on-year to 217,510vehicles globally, as the coronavirus outbreak continued to hit demand in key markets.

headline: Analysts' View: Impact of the U.S. protests on financial markets
text: National Guard troops have been deployed in 15 U.S. states and the U.S. capital after five nights of violence and destruction that began with peaceful protests over the death of a black man, George Floyd, in police custody.

headline: Workers nervously eye return to Lear's coronavirus-hit plant in Mexico

headline: Escalating China tensions could become an obstacle for U.S. stock rally

headline: Delta, union working to avoid furloughs of 2,300 pilots

headline: Coty to appoint Chairman Peter Harf as its new CEO: WSJ
text: Coty Inc  is set to announce that Peter Harf, its current chairman, will become the cosmetics company's new chief executive officer, replacing Pierre Laubies, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline: Renault factory worker spared layoffs - for now

headline: Volkswagen pumps 2 billion euros into China electric vehicle bet
text: Volkswagen AG  plans to boost its electric push in China, the world's biggest auto market, by pumping 2.1 billion euros in two Chinese electric vehicle players.

headline: Volkswagen says it will have full control of JAC-VW Chinese venture

headline: Danish state prosecutor drops investigation of Danske Bank auditor EY

headline: German official sees Lufthansa bailout in reach, demands fairness

text: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager denied on Friday that she was putting hurdles in the way of Lufthansa's  $10 billion government rescue, saying companies getting big capital injections from the state have to offset their competitive advantage.
